00033 ATTRIBUTE_ALIGNED16(class) btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver : public btConstraintSolver
00034 {
00035 protected:
00036         btAlignedObjectArray<btSolverBody>      m_tmpSolverBodyPool;
00037         btConstraintArray                       m_tmpSolverContactConstraintPool;
00038         btConstraintArray                       m_tmpSolverNonContactConstraintPool;
00039         btConstraintArray                       m_tmpSolverContactFrictionConstraintPool;
00040         btConstraintArray                       m_tmpSolverContactRollingFrictionConstraintPool;
00041 
00042         btAlignedObjectArray<int>       m_orderTmpConstraintPool;
00043         btAlignedObjectArray<int>       m_orderNonContactConstraintPool;
00044         btAlignedObjectArray<int>       m_orderFrictionConstraintPool;
00045         btAlignedObjectArray<btTypedConstraint::btConstraintInfo1> m_tmpConstraintSizesPool;
00046         int                                                     m_maxOverrideNumSolverIterations;
00047         int m_fixedBodyId;
00048     // When running solvers on multiple threads, a race condition exists for Kinematic objects that
00049     // participate in more than one solver.
00050     // The getOrInitSolverBody() function writes the companionId of each body (storing the index of the solver body
00051     // for the current solver). For normal dynamic bodies it isn't an issue because they can only be in one island
00052     // (and therefore one thread) at a time. But kinematic bodies can be in multiple islands at once.
00053     // To avoid this race condition, this solver does not write the companionId, instead it stores the solver body
00054     // index in this solver-local table, indexed by the uniqueId of the body.
00055     btAlignedObjectArray<int>   m_kinematicBodyUniqueIdToSolverBodyTable;  // only used for multithreading
00056 
00057         btSingleConstraintRowSolver m_resolveSingleConstraintRowGeneric;
00058         btSingleConstraintRowSolver m_resolveSingleConstraintRowLowerLimit;
00059     btSingleConstraintRowSolver m_resolveSplitPenetrationImpulse;
00060     int m_cachedSolverMode;  // used to check if SOLVER_SIMD flag has been changed
00061     void setupSolverFunctions( bool useSimd );
00062 
00063         btScalar        m_leastSquaresResidual;
00064 
00065         void setupFrictionConstraint(   btSolverConstraint& solverConstraint, const btVector3& normalAxis,int solverBodyIdA,int  solverBodyIdB,
00066                                                                         btManifoldPoint& cp,const btVector3& rel_pos1,const btVector3& rel_pos2,
00067                                                                         btCollisionObject* colObj0,btCollisionObject* colObj1, btScalar relaxation, 
00068                                                                         const btContactSolverInfo& infoGlobal,
00069                                                                         btScalar desiredVelocity=0., btScalar cfmSlip=0.);
00070 
00071         void setupTorsionalFrictionConstraint(  btSolverConstraint& solverConstraint, const btVector3& normalAxis,int solverBodyIdA,int  solverBodyIdB,
00072                                                                         btManifoldPoint& cp,btScalar combinedTorsionalFriction, const btVector3& rel_pos1,const btVector3& rel_pos2,
00073                                                                         btCollisionObject* colObj0,btCollisionObject* colObj1, btScalar relaxation, 
00074                                                                         btScalar desiredVelocity=0., btScalar cfmSlip=0.);
00075 
00076         btSolverConstraint&     addFrictionConstraint(const btVector3& normalAxis,int solverBodyIdA,int solverBodyIdB,int frictionIndex,btManifoldPoint& cp,const btVector3& rel_pos1,const btVector3& rel_pos2,btCollisionObject* colObj0,btCollisionObject* colObj1, btScalar relaxation, const btContactSolverInfo& infoGlobal, btScalar desiredVelocity=0., btScalar cfmSlip=0.);
00077         btSolverConstraint&     addTorsionalFrictionConstraint(const btVector3& normalAxis,int solverBodyIdA,int solverBodyIdB,int frictionIndex,btManifoldPoint& cp,btScalar torsionalFriction, const btVector3& rel_pos1,const btVector3& rel_pos2,btCollisionObject* colObj0,btCollisionObject* colObj1, btScalar relaxation, btScalar desiredVelocity=0, btScalar cfmSlip=0.f);
